text: Answer: (b) and (c) Solution: (@) False. In non-preemptive, current process release the CPU on completion or blocked due to some 10 activity. (b) True. If current process perform blocking system call then always result in a context switch of the running process, even in a non-preemptive kernel design (c) True. The system call exit, to terminate the current process. (d) False. Reason same as option (a).
